title: Japanese destroyer Kaba (1915)
text:
was the <a href="name%20ship">name ship</a> of <a href="Kaba-class%20destroyer">her class</a> of 10 <a href="destroyer">destroyer</a>s that were built for the <a href="Imperial%20Japanese%20Navy">Imperial Japanese Navy</a> during <a href="World%20War%20I">World War I</a>.
Design and description.
The "Kaba"-class destroyers were improved versions of the preceding . They <a href="Displacement%20%28ship%29">displaced</a> at normal load and at <a href="deep%20load">deep load</a>. The ships had a <a href="length%20between%20perpendiculars">length between perpendiculars</a> of and an <a href="length%20overall">overall length</a> of , a <a href="beam%20%28nautical%29">beam</a> of and a <a href="draft%20%28ship%29">draught</a> of . The "Kaba"s were powered by three <a href="Marine%20steam%20engine%23Triple%20or%20multiple%20expansion">vertical triple-expansion steam engines</a>, each driving one shaft using steam produced by four <a href="Kampon">Kampon</a> <a href="water-tube%20boiler">water-tube boiler</a>s. Two boilers burned a mixture of coal and <a href="fuel%20oil">fuel oil</a> while the other pair only used oil. The engines produced a total of that gave the ships a maximum speed of . They carried a maximum of of coal and of oil which gave them a range of at a speed of . Their crew consisted of 92 officers and <a href="naval%20rating">ratings</a>.
The main armament of the "Kaba"-class ships consisted of a single <a href="quick-firing%20gun">quick-firing (QF)</a> <a href="QF%204.7-inch%20Mk%20I%20%E2%80%93%20IV%20naval%20gun">gun</a> located on the <a href="bow%20%28ship%29">bow</a>. They were also armed with four <a href="QF%2012-pounder%2012%20cwt%20naval%20gun">QF guns</a> on single mounts. Two guns were positioned abreast the middle <a href="funnel%20%28ship%29">funnel</a>, one gun was on the aft <a href="superstructure">superstructure</a> and the fourth gun was on the <a href="stern">stern</a>. The destroyers' <a href="torpedo">torpedo</a> armament consisted of two twin rotating mounts for torpedoes located between the superstructure and the stern gun.
Construction and career.
"Kaba" was <a href="Ship%20launching">launched</a> on 6 February 1915 at the <a href="Yokosuka%20Naval%20Arsenal">Yokosuka Naval Arsenal</a> and completed on 5 March. The ship played a minor role during World War I. She was stricken from the <a href="navy%20list">navy list</a> in November 1931, <a href="Ship%20decommissioning">decommissioned</a> on 1 April 1932 and subsequently broken up.
